alert.note: Alert for Northern Jasper; Northern Newton; Northern Orange; Southern Jasper; Southern Newton; Southern Orange (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Lake Charles (Southeast Texas and Southwest Louisiana)
info.headline: Fire Weather Watch issued September 30 at 5:29AM CDT until October 01 at 8:00PM CDT by NWS Lake Charles
info.description: ...Red Flag Warning for portions of Southeast Texas, Central and Southern Louisiana Saturday... .Relative humidity values between 25 and 35 percent with highs in the mid to upper 90s will be possible Saturday afternoon. Meanwhile, fuels in this area are extremely dry due to the ongoing exceptional drought. This combined with sustained 20 foot winds from the east to east-northeast at 7 to 12 mph with gusts to 20 mph will favor initiation and rapid spread of wildland fires. ...RED FLAG WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 10 AM TO 8 PM CDT SATURDAY FOR FOR LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY AND DRY FUELS PORTIONS OF SOUTHEAST TEXAS, CENTRAL AND SOUTHERN LOUISIANA... ...FIRE WEATHER WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM SUNDAY MORNING THROUGH SUNDAY EVENING FOR LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY AND DRY FUELS FOR PORTIONS OF SOUTHEAST TEXAS, CENTRAL AND SOUTHERN LOUISIANA... * AFFECTED AREA...Vernon, Rapides, Avoyelles, Beauregard, Allen, Evangeline, St. Landry, Lafayette, Upper St. Martin, Northern Calcasieu, Northern Jefferson Davis, Northern Acadia, Southern Calcasieu, Southern Jefferson Davis, Southern Acadia, Northern Jasper, Northern Newton, Southern Jasper, Southern Newton, Northern Orange and Southern Orange. * TIMING...1000 AM CDT until 800 PM CDT on Saturday, and 1000 AM CDT until 800 PM CDT on Sunday. * WINDS...East 7 to 12 mph. Gusts up to 20 mph. * RELATIVE HUMIDITY...As low as 25 percent. * TEMPERATURES...mid to upper 90s. * IMPACTS...Any fires that develop will likely spread rapidly. Outdoor burning is not recommended.
info.instruction: A Red Flag Warning means that critical fire weather conditions are either occurring now, or will shortly. A combination of strong winds, low relative humidity, and warm temperatures can contribute to extreme fire behavior. A Fire Weather Watch means that critical fire weather conditions are forecast to occur. Listen for later forecasts and possible Red Flag Warnings.
